[30;1m1302 | [0m[35m                but you may not obtain the requested reduction.[0m

[30;1m2618 | [0m[35m        The orientation of the polygons that form the surface is important.[0m
[30;1m2619 | [0m[35m        Polygons have a front face and a back face, and it's the back face that defines[0m
[30;1m2620 | [0m[35m        the interior or "solid" region of the closed surface.[0m
[30;1m2621 | [0m[35m        When a plane cuts through a "solid" region, a new cut face is generated,[0m
[30;1m2622 | [0m[35m        but not when a clipping plane cuts through a hole or "empty" region.[0m
[30;1m2623 | [0m[35m        This distinction is crucial when dealing with complex surfaces.[0m
[30;1m2624 | [0m[35m        Note that if a simple surface has its back faces pointing outwards,[0m

[30;1m3142 | [0m[35m        For each input point, the distance to all points in its neighborhood is computed.[0m
[30;1m3143 | [0m[35m        If any of its neighbors is further than the target distance,[0m
[30;1m3144 | [0m[35m        the edge connecting the point and its neighbor is bisected and[0m
[30;1m3145 | [0m[35m        a new point is inserted at the bisection point.[0m
[30;1m3146 | [0m[35m        A single pass is completed once all the input points are visited.[0m
[30;1m3147 | [0m[35m        Then the process repeats to the number of iterations.[0m

[30;1m2677 | [0m[35m        in the "flat" regions of the volume while maintaining the opacity[0m
[30;1m2678 | [0m[35m        at the boundaries between material types.  The gradient is measured[0m
[30;1m2679 | [0m[35m        as the amount by which the intensity changes over unit distance.[0m
[30;1m2680 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m2681 | [0m[35m        The format for alpha_grad is the same as for method `volume.alpha()`.[0m

[30;1m73 | [0m[35m- Delaunay triangulation in 2D and 3D.[0m
[30;1m74 | [0m[35m- Generate meshes by joining nearby lines in space.[0m
[30;1m75 | [0m[35m- Find the closest path from one point to another, traveling along the edges of a mesh.[0m

[30;1m4 | [0m[35m  u'= Laplace(u) + f  in a square domain[0m
[30;1m5 | [0m[35m  u = u_D             on the boundary[0m
[30;1m6 | [0m[35m  u = u_0             at t = 0[0m
[30;1m7 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35m  u_D = f = 0[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m948 | [0m[35m                hs = np.hstack((np.zeros(nf)[:, None] + nc, faces))[0m
[30;1m949 | [0m[35m            else:[0m
[30;1m950 | [0m[35m                nf = faces.shape[0][0m

[30;1m1282 | [0m[35m            min_radius: (float)[0m
[30;1m1283 | [0m[35m                impose a minimum distance between points.[0m
[30;1m1284 | [0m[35m                If `min_radius` is set to 0, the points are[0m
[30;1m1285 | [0m[35m                generated uniformly at random inside the mesh.[0m
[30;1m1286 | [0m[35m                If `min_radius` is set to a positive value,[0m
[30;1m1287 | [0m[35m                the points are generated uniformly at random[0m
[30;1m1288 | [0m[35m                inside the mesh, but points closer than `min_radius`[0m

[30;1m1004 | [0m[35m    Note that orientation is interpolated using quaternions via[0m
[30;1m1005 | [0m[35m    SLERP (spherical linear interpolation) or the special `vtkQuaternionSpline` class.[0m
[30;1m1006 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m1007 | [0m[35m    To use this class, add at least two pairs of (t, transformation) with the add() method.[0m
[30;1m1008 | [0m[35m    Then interpolate the transforms with the `TransformInterpolator(t)` call method,[0m
[30;1m1009 | [0m[35m    where "t" must be in the range of `(min, max)` times specified by the add() method.[0m
[30;1m1010 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m20 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35mdef d_dt(psi):  # find Psi(t+dt)-Psi(t) /dt with 4th order Runge-Kutta method[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35m    k1 = f(psi)[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35m    k2 = f(psi + dt / 2 * k1)[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35m    k3 = f(psi + dt / 2 * k2)[0m
